caption:
🧼✨ Your gut is like a dishwasher—and if it doesn’t clean properly, leftover food (aka bacteria) builds up in all the wrong places!  Your Migrating Motor Complex (MMC) is your gut’s built-in cleaning cycle. Every 90-120 minutes between meals, it sweeps out undigested food and bacteria with cleaning waves to keep your small intestine fresh. But if your MMC isn’t working properly (due to stress, infections, or slow motility), bacteria can stick around and overgrow—leading to SIBO or Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth.

If you’re dealing with bloating, diarrhea, constipation, or feeling “backed up” after eating, your gut’s "dishwasher" might not be working properly. 🌀🚫 

✅ The Trio-Smart at-home breath test is the only test that can check for all 3 gases associated with bacterial overgrowth: Hydrogen, Methane, and Hydrogen Sulfide.
